comments.content: Beauclair, did you find that prior thread using the search tool? I'm asking this because search doesn't seem to work for me anymore. I always get a page not found. There's then a search field on that page that gives me no returned results. I even tried searching using the term "serif" and got no results.
Search still don't work yet again. Your best option is adding site:typophile.com to a web search.

riccardO is spot on. If you have the Google Toolbar (or Googlebar Lite in FF) type in your search term and click on the "search this site" button.

Now that we've "improved" the site with gray balls, red balls, and flaming red balls with no legend, and we have people bypassing the homepage because it is a waste of time and so crappy, here's yet another workaround -- for a search that doesn't search.

I wanted to edit my previous post to ask what purpose the red bullets serve when 99% of all posts on 99% of all pages had the same bullet.

But alas, edit doesn't seem to be working at the moment.

Ah, progress.
@Beauclair: no, it hasnâ€™t been discussed _before_, but after: this thread is 7 years old.
